alert.note: Alert for Chester; Fayette; Hardeman; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 9:59PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Marshall, Tippah, Benton, northwestern Alcorn, southeastern Fayette, Hardeman, McNairy and southern Chester Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 959 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Chickasaw State Park to 7 miles northeast of Canaan to 6 miles southeast of Holly Springs. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corinth, Holly Springs, Henderson, Bolivar, Ripley, Selmer, Chickasaw State Park, Chickasaw State Forest, Big Hill Pond State Park, Lamar, Whiteville, Adamsville, Blue Mountain, Snow Lake Shores, Silerton, Masseyville, Theo, Canaan, Pocahontas and Lagrange. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi...and west Tennessee.
